title: Beautiful use of Red Sandstone
text: This attraction 40 km west of Agra was certainly not deserted when we visited it in the afternoon.  Several coach parties descended on an exterior vehicle park and then transferred to the shuttle bus to take us up to the ramparts.  If you have seen a red fort before there will be not too much different to view apart from some original paintings of elephants! It was part of a fortified ancient city capital of the Mughal empire between 1572 and 1585 after which its water source dried up.  We were not encouraged to view the mosque which was more imposing and there were several other sites along the ridge we wish the guide had had time to view.
